intro: Keithia denudata, commonly known as the naked keithia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
